reviewTextParts/Disliked: The Air conditioner had a very bad smell when we used it. This smell was also to the main pool where the AC had the ventilators. reviewTextParts/Liked: This resort was a beautiful place where we got relax on the various beaches or pools ( main pool, salted water pool, kids pool with slides), enjoyed good food and splendid views, we got relaxing massages for adults and kids, and also practiced a lot of activities ( basketball, scubadiving) we also rented a boat, we have done quad safari, visited museums in Heraklion and Cretaquarium. The staff is very helpful every time we asked them for anything.

reviewTextParts/Disliked:
The spa was disappointing. I went for a deep cleansing facial and the lady put tinted moisturizer on my face and pretended that she did such an amazing job. I don’t wear makeup so this was quite annoying when the purpose of my visit was for a deep clean. The massage was not great either. The ladies were kind but I regret going.
The entertainment had good energy for kids but was too loud and harmful to the hearing of the kids they called to come to the stage. I requested them to lower the volume but was disregarded multiple times over our two week stay. Also one of the French guys who did entertainment was very rude when we asked to turn down the volume.
reviewTextParts/Liked: Beautiful hotel, excellent buffet selection (especially the seafood night), great views!! I would recommend this resort to anyone who doesn’t want to leave their location they have everything you need and multiple areas to enjoy the view. Great for couples and families. The cocktails by the beach were excellent. The front desk was very kind and accommodating. You are able to take a bus into town from the hotel or book day trips.

reviewTextParts/Liked: Отель располагается в красивом месте в 30-минутах езды от аэропорта Ираклион. Фотографии на сайте полностью отражают действительность. Есть собственный пляж (рядом находящиеся 5-звездочные отели предлагают использовать довольно непрезентабельный общественный пляж) и два бассейна. Большая территория с уединенными локациями. Удобные номера (брали с видом на море - потрясающий вид), ежедневная качественная уборка. Разнообразный шведский стол. Отель предлагает экскурсии по Криту, но мы их брать не стали. Планировали взять на месте машину на прокат и поездить самостоятельно, но передумали. Погода располагала к пассивному отдыху)))надеемся вернуться)))

reviewTextParts/Liked:
Nous avions réservé au mois de juillet une suite avec piscine privée pour 2 nuits afin de finir notre séjour en Crète en beauté. 3 jours avant notre arrivée, l'hôtel nous informe avoir eu un problème dans le système des réservations et que notre chambre n'était plus disponible.
Très déçu, nous leurs avons fait part de notre mécontentement. L'hôtel a de suite prit les devants afin de nous proposer le meilleur service pour que nous puissions tout de même profiter de l'hôtel.
TRÈS BELLE SURPRISE.
Nous avons été placé en Suite Junior all inclusive inclusive avec vue sur mer, la chambre était très propre, et fonctionnelle. La vue... Exceptionnelle.
Nous avons vite oublié la piscine privée, qui ne nous aurait pas servie à grand chose vu le nombre de piscines qu'il y a dans l'hôtel, en plus de la mer.
Le personnel de l'hôtel est serviable, agréable, prend la peine de parler  français lorsque vous avez du mal avec les langues étrangères.
De nombreuse activités sont proposées, tel que, basket, pétanque, quad etc..
La randonnée en Quad est à faire, c'était vraiment top.
Le buffet est varié, et bon à chaque repas. Tout est frais, il y en a pour tout les goûts.
En résumé, vous pouvez aller dans cet hôtel les yeux fermés, vous ne serez pas déçu.
Ps: si vous êtes en voiture, vous avez la possibilité de vous garer dans un parking privé réservé pour l'hôtel.
roomInfo: Junior Suite with Sea View

reviewTextParts/Disliked:
To improve
There’s not a lot I can complain about, more small improvements I would expect the resort to do to get to be a real 5-stars.
Our room didn’t have a single chair where to put things inside. And it’s very easy to spend 50€ on a cheap chair so at least one would have it.
And it didn’t have anything to hang wet swimsuits outside.
We had to use the 4 outdoor chairs to put our wet things. Easy improvement is to spend 5€ on a plastic drying rack and fix it to a wall and remove the annoyance.
There was no easily available shower in the pool areas, despite there being a sign saying that one had to shower before entering the pool. Pretty weird. 100€ would give you enough money to install one.
There was no lifeguard on duty anywhere, this is a pretty serious issue to me as a father of two kids (despite them being expert swimmers). I would invest in hiring someone. That could also help ending the bad practice of “reserving” Sun beds early in the morning from customers.
Room doors are surprisingly thin and walls don’t insulate very well from noises, bring earplugs if you want to sleep.
One night a bunch of not-so-smart folks started kicking doors and managed to even open one, with just one strong kick. That needs a review from the hotel.
Air conditioning filters would need to be cleaned regularly, as after heavy use ours started pumping bad quality air in. I don’t know how often it happens. Once a month is enough, but filters need to be cleaned more often than they are now. Simple but a must.
Overall food quality is good, and i understand that it’s difficult to keep quality of every single dish high. One thing I would invest in however is to improve the quality of the products available: especially jam, oil, coke, orange juices, coffee and such . Those are small cost items, but having a bad quality jam or low quality oil (especially for a country that produces one of the best olive oils on the planet) can be easily spotted (and easily improved).
reviewTextParts/Liked:
The location of the resort is absolutely stunning, get a room with sea view and you’ll wake up every day with an amazing feeling. The resort is situated on a cliff overlooking the blue sea of Crete, and since it’s a small gulf it is well protected from waves and wind in most directions. It gets windy only when the wind comes from northeast, otherwise the sea is flat like a table.
The room seemed pretty new (in 2023), clean and spacious. Beds very comfortable. Curtains cover pretty well the sun in the morning but depending in how sensitive you are to light you might want to bring some night mask. There’s air conditioning in case it gets hot (and it will).
In our room there was a big wardrobe with plenty of space for our needs.
A water boiler and a fridge were also available.
A safe box was also there to keep our valuables.
The restaurant is very functional and given the big amount of guests it favors quantity over quality. Not that quality is bad, but it varies a lot depending on the food, it’s an inconsistent experience.
We loved the freshly baked pizzas, the meat, pork and fish cooked on the grill and the fresh veggies and fruits. Breakfast (which opens at 3AM!!!) was rich, we loved the crepes and the fresh pastries.
The two pools (one with sea water) are large enough for all the guests. There’s also a spa with an additional pool (which we didn’t use).
The private “beach” (which in reality is a concrete deck) is fantastic, almost never crowded, and gives you access to crystal clear water and a beautiful seabed, you have to walk more than a few steps down to reach it (and up again) but totally worth it.
You can also access two public beaches (Psaramoura and Mononafitis) in case you want variety, where you can rent sun beds and umbrellas in case you want, but where you can also find a corner to put your stuff  and dive in the sea.
There’s a scuba diving school in case you are interested and you can rent boats and pedal boats in case.
reviewTitle: Superb location, very good food, fantastic sea, great vacation. Missing just a few details to reach excellent status.

reviewTextParts/Disliked: Der Parkplatz des Hotels ist winzig. Zwar gibt es eine Zufahrt zu einer weiteren Ebene, aber die ist extrem steil und im unteren Bereich stark ausgewaschen. Glücklicherweise haben wir uns das vorher angeguckt und verzichteten dann darauf, dort hinunterzufahren. Mit unserem kleinen Mietwagen wären wir mit Sicherheit aufgesetzt. Also mussten wir in größerer Entfernung zum Hotel am Straßenrand parken. Das Essen im Restaurant ist vielseitig, aber nur mit wenigen griechischen Komponenten. Die Atmosphäre ist eher hektisch und laut.
reviewTextParts/Liked: Unser Zimmer war supertoll! Allerdings haben wir unerwartet ein kostenloses Upgrade und damit nicht nur ein Zimmer mit Meerblick, sondern auch mit eigenem Privatpool erhalten. Das war natürlich großartig! Das Zimmer war sehr sauber und vor allem ruhig zum Meer hin gelegen und abseits des Trubels an Restaurant und Pool. Die Betten war sehr bequem. Das Personal an der Rezeption war sehr nett und freundlich. WLAN war sehr gut.

reviewTextParts/Disliked: Uns hat es super gut gefallen, allerdings ist das Hotel für einige sicher nicht das richtige. - Für kleinere Kinder ist das Hotel eher nicht geeignet - ich hätte Angst, dass sie irgendwo runterstürzen. Da unsere schon groß sind, war das für uns allerdings kein Problem.- Der Ort ist ungefähr 20 Gehminuten entfernt und eher weniger interessant. Für Leute die Nightlife oder Shopping wollen, ist das nix.  - Die vielen Stufen sind sicher auch nicht jedermanns/frau Sache. - Der Strand ist ein Kiesstrand der öffentlich ist (also nicht nur Hotelgäste). Das Hotel hat aber eine Betonplattform von der man direkt ins Meer kann -- für uns war das perfekt.- Die Fleischgerichte haben uns weniger geschmeckt.
reviewTextParts/Liked: Da das Hotel auf einem Felsen über dem Meer ragt, hat man eine wunderschöne Aussicht auf das Meer. Der Standort bringt aber für Leute mit Gehbehinderungen Schwierigkeiten, da man einige Höhenmeter überbrücken muss um zwischen Meerebene, Poolebene, Zimmerebene und Essen hin und her zu gehen. Wir habe es als Fitnesstraining betrachtet :)Zimmer waren sehr sauber und modern eingerichtet - alles ohne schnick-schnack. Wunderschöne Aussicht aufs Meer!Das Essen war einfach und gut -- vor allem die vegetarischen Gerichte.Das Personal war nett aber zurückhaltend. Es gibt eine Animation -- allerdings nur auf Französisch. Zum Mitturnen haben meine Französischkenntnisse gereicht :)

reviewTextParts/Disliked: Animazione francese, si potrebbe migliorare sull’organizzazione delle serate per coinvolgere maggiormente gli ospiti.
reviewTextParts/Liked: Posto molto bello, personale cordiale e disponibile. Si ha la possibilità di mangiare all’interno del grosso ristorante oppure nei tavoli a bordo piscina. Puoi scegliere tra mare, piscina con acqua salata o piscina con cloro. Cucina internazionale buona, pizza da colazione a cena e pasta cucinata al momento. vicino all’hotel ci sono delle attività come quad safari e noleggio barche. Vacanza super relax
roomInfo: Double or Twin Room with Sea View

reviewTextParts/Disliked:
Nous avions la chambre avec la piscine privée vue mer : eau très froide !
La nourriture n’est pas incroyable comme on pourrait le croire dans les commentaires
Ce n’est stipulé nul part mais il s’agit d’un club avec des animations matin, après-midi et soir
L’hôtel n’est pas très bien situé : plus de 3h de route pour les visites incontournables de la Crète
reviewTextParts/Liked:
La chambre avec la piscine privée vue mer est un vrai plus : la vue est incroyable pour le lever et coucher du soleil.
La propreté des chambres
La gentillesse du personnel
La possibilité de louer très facilement une voiture de location à 50m de l’hôtel
2 piscines chauffées et plage privée très agréable
roomInfo: Superior Sea View Room with Private Pool

reviewTextParts/Disliked: Tutto perfetto solo che l'animazione la sera è tutto in francese..... Ma per il resto tutto perfetto!
reviewTextParts/Liked:
Tutto perfetto 😀
Accoglienza al reception,
Pulizia nella camera impeccabile...
Gentilezza e disponibilità di tutto il personale sia nei snack bar sia in sala... Ottima cucina...
Cibo super qualità,
quantità e tanta scelta!
Siamo trovati veramente benissimo... 🤗complimenti e un grazie a tutto il personale che ci hanno fatto passare un vacanza indimenticabile!😍
roomInfo: Double or Twin Room with Mountain View

reviewTextParts/Disliked:
Badezimmer sehr sehr alt und nicht ganz sauber.
Am Hauptpool alle Liegen besetzt und sehr voll
Check in Zeit war erst ab 15 Uhr, ich war erst gegen 15.45 dran! Nicht um 14 Uhr wir angegeben. Und dann check out bereits um 11? Nicht in Ordnung.
reviewTextParts/Liked:
Die Aussicht und der private Pool waren atemberaubend.
Das essen und die Auswahl war ok
roomInfo: Superior Sea View Room with Private Pool

reviewTextParts/Disliked:
-Unterhaltungsprogramme nur auf Französisch.
-Allgemein mehr Französisch als Englisch oder Deutsch.
-Buffet, vor allem Frühstück sollte mehr vegetarische Auswahl haben.
-Viel Müll und Plastiknutzung in der Anlage, lag auch viel verteilt in den Gebüschen, am Wegrand.
-Liegen und Schirme sehen teilweise sehr stark abgenutzt aus.
-An der Rezeption wurde uns ständig was Versprochen, jedoch nicht eingehalten. Wir haben z. B. über 1 Stunde gewartet um eine Aktivität zu buchen und wurden hin gehalten.
Genauso hat sich auch der Check In gezogen.
reviewTextParts/Liked:
-Zimmer relativ gut sauber, hell u. modern.
-Personal (Kellner) Sehr freundlich und fleißig.
-Essen vom Buffet meistens sehr lecker.
-Top Aussicht auf das Meer von fast allen Seiten aus.
-Schöne Strände, tolles Meer.
roomInfo: Double or Twin Room with Sea View

reviewTextParts/Liked: Hotel pięknie położony, wspaniałe widoki z okna, barierka balkonu z szyby, dzięki czemu widok na morze można było podziwiać leżąc w łóżku. Pyszne jedzenie, codziennie coś nowego. Pani z recepcji zamówiła dla naszej 9-osobowej grupy transfer na lotnisko w Chanii ( 200 euro) - bardzo dziękujemy za pomoc.
roomInfo: Superior Double Room with Sea View

reviewTextParts/Disliked: Il Pagamento al Check-in, quando ancora non c'era stato offerto nessun servizio (non visualizzando nemmeno la stanza). Il fatto che i Camerieri a Ristorante, avevano molta fretta di levare i piatti dal tavolo ed erano a volte scontrosi (poco personale secondo noi per gestire una struttura del genere). Bibite non originali; soprattutto il caffè che era per la maggior parte acqua. Ristornate non pulito al massimo. Animazione completamente in Francese: poco coinvolgente per le altre persone e a volte ripetitiva. Per quanto riguarda la pulizia delle stanze, veniva effettuata alle 14:30 (2.30 PM) non dando la possibilità agli ospiti di riposare.
reviewTextParts/Liked: Abbiamo soggiornato presso questo resort per 6 giorni. Struttura molto moderna e curata. Belle camere; molto spaziose e confortevoli. Avevamo una vista mare eccezionale (nella seconda stanza, la prima aveva una siepe coprente). Cibo vario con vasta scelta abbastanza soddisfacente. Vista mare dalle terrazze con piscine mozzafiato. Ben collegato alle 3 spiagge presenti (via scale o salita stradale). Carino il negozio di souvenir all'interno della struttura (tutte le varie sale collegate con ascensore o passaggi). Un grazie ed un complimento speciale alla signora Fotinì, e alla ragazza della reception che parlava molto bene l'italiano: cordiali e sempre disponibili per qualsiasi richiesta. Siamo rimasti molto soddisfatti anche dal fatto che ci hanno lasciato la stanza fino alle 14.00 e ci hanno fatto usufruire dell'All Inclusive fino alla nostra partenza con taxi. Organizzati di escursioni e sport di tutti i tipi.
reviewTitle: Un Rilassante e piacevole Soggiorno a Creta.
roomInfo: Double or Twin Room with Sea View

reviewTextParts/Liked: Отличный отель. Персонал клиентоориентирован. Заселили раньше, бесплатно повысили категорию номера, не взяли оплату за обеды в день приезда и отъезда. Пляж -  плита со спусками, нам такой очень нравится, вода чистейшая, прозрачная, даже когда ветер волн не бывает. Есть 2 пляжа с нормальным входом. Вид из номера на море радует и расслабляет.  Питание хорошее, всегда присутствовали морепродукты: мидии, кальмары, улитки, устрицы, разнообразная рыба. На экскурсии не ездили, но предложения там были.
roomInfo: Two-Bedroom Family Room with Sea View

reviewTextParts/Liked: Le personnel est gentil accueillant à votre écoute, je n’ai pas de point négatif tellement que tout était parfait
roomInfo: Double or Twin Room with Mountain View

reviewTextParts/Disliked: Det franske underholdning var forfærdeligt. Godt man ikke skulle se på det😀
reviewTextParts/Liked: Beliggenhed var perfekt. God og varieret mad i buffeen
roomInfo: Two-Bedroom Bungalow with Sea View

reviewTextParts/Disliked: J'ai beau cherché, je ne trouve pas... A part quelques porcs qui pensent que parce qu'ils sont en vacances, ils peuvent se permettre de laisser dégueulasse derrière eux et que le personnel nettoyera ... Ce qui est fait bien sûr
reviewTextParts/Liked: Tout. La chambre (chambre familiale vue mer des deux chambres séparées, parents King size et enfants/ados en lits jumeaux, climatisées), la terrasse des chambres avec sur la piscine et la mer, les repas (beaucoup de variétés, possibilité de prendre le pique nique de midi), les piscines, la plage, le personnel discret et serviable, la propreté, j'en oublie sûrement. L'hotel était apparemment complet mais on ne s'en rend pas vraiment compte. J'y reviendrai avec plaisir
roomInfo: Two-Bedroom Family Room with Sea View

reviewTextParts/Liked: L’esperienza è stata a dir poco stupenda. La posizione perfetta, più piscine e la propria spiaggia. La stanza era con una vista mozzafiato sul mare. Ci sono i bar che offrono ottimi cocktail(si sente l’alcool di qualità) e buonissimo cibo. Ci torneremo sicuramente.
roomInfo: Junior Suite with Sea View

reviewTextParts/Disliked: Нет спасательных кругов на бетонном пляже. Волны там бывают часто, из за этого плавать иногда не безопасно. Спасателей на пляже не видела.
reviewTextParts/Liked: Еда вкусная, необычный отель. Номер просторный
roomInfo: Double or Twin Room with Mountain View

reviewTextParts/Liked: Szobák szépek voltak, kiszolgálás nagyon jó volt, a személyzet minden egyes tagja nagyon kedves volt. Mindig próbáltak a kedvünkben járni és folyamatosan érdeklődtek, hogy minden rendben van-e. Érkezéskor kicsit várni kellett a szoba átadására, amit megjegyzés nélkül egy ajándék vacsorával szerettek volna rögtön jóvá is tenni.
reviewTitle: Nagyon kedves személyzet, igényes szobák és gyönyörű kilátás a tengerre.
roomInfo: Superior Double Room with Sea View

reviewTextParts/Disliked: Il manque une salle de sport. Les équipements piscine pour les enfants sont très peu nombreux.
roomInfo: Junior Suite with Sea View

reviewTextParts/Disliked: La pulizia della camera è da migliorare, abbiamo trovato più volte capelli non nostri.Il cibo, se pur ottimo, dopo un po' di giorni è sembrato un po' ripetitivo.
reviewTextParts/Liked: Siamo stati al Resort per 16 notti. Abbiamo prenotato una camera vista mare, un panorama impagabile. Eravamo con sistemazione All-inclusive, colazione pranzo e cena tutto a buffet. Il cibo varia molto ma alla fine della vacanza eravamo un po' stufi, dopo un po' sembra ripetitivo ma è un limite del "tutto incluso"Camera molto spaziosa, vista meravigliosa.Un grazie speciale alla reception, molto gentili e disponibili. L'ultimo giorno con l'aereo in partenza tardi ci hanno sistemato in una piccola camera in forma gratuita.
roomInfo: Superior Double Room with Sea View

reviewTextParts/Disliked: C'est un club et ça ne ressort pas franchement du site internet ni de la présentation booking. Donc la musique "boum boum" à la piscine ET à la plage non-stop, ça peut surprendre qd on ne s'y attend pas. Ceci dit, il y a moyen d'y échapper facilement. Plus gênant en revanche : la propreté et l'entretien: escaliers de piscines franchement sales, piscines laiteuses et mauvaises herbes un peu partout. La sale de restauration n'est pas climatisée et "officiellement" il n'est pas possible de manger sur les tables dehors (règle à laquelle on a fini par déroger tellement que c'était insupportable) Si le personnel était occupé à entretenir plutot qu'à "divertir" ce serait un paradis!
reviewTextParts/Liked: La situation géographique sur la mer, une vue sublime et 4 piscines et 3 plages : rien n'est jms complets, on a mm eu des instants de piscines que pour nous (en plein mois d'août)!
roomInfo: Two-Bedroom Bungalow with Sea View

reviewTextParts/Disliked: Les -: Pas de prise dans la salle de bain (une seule prise par un seche cheveux), température de l'eau compliquée à regler (ou bien très chaud, ou bien tiède, mais vu les 46 degrés dehors, le tiède allait très bien).Et deux chambres à côté de la notre se trouvait un enclot avec deux chiens de garde qui aboient parfoid la nuit ou tôt le matin, incomodant quand on a le someil très léger, mais je récise qu'en dehors de ça, la chambre est d'un calme absolu et la vue impéccable (moiti" montagne, moitié mer).
reviewTextParts/Liked: Les +: hotel super grand, super propre, personnel au top, buffet all in très complet, varié, excellente cuisine, possibilité de se restaurer toute la journée aux différents bars en dehors des heures de buffet.Chambre spacieuse (la 905 pour moi et mon fils), propre, enorme placards, terrasse pour toute les chambres.Animation super, mini club pour les enfants 2h le matin et 1h30 l'après midi, piscines enormes et très agréable (piscine de chlore, piscine d'eau de mer en contre bas (ensoleillée jusqu'au soir), piscine avec tobogan pour les enfants, piscine interieur. ce séjour de 10 jours a été une très belle surprise. Je précise que les mojito sont souvent décevant mais alors dans cet hotel, aucun doute ils savent les faire, de plus, les recettes sont strictes, donc au moins ils ont le même gout à chaque fois. Une autre belle découverte en cocktail: "The Med", excellent.
roomInfo: Double or Twin Room with Mountain View

reviewTextParts/Disliked: La piscina con gli scivoli è fuori mano, infatti non ci siamo mai andati, la spiaggia tsimento non è sabbiosa, ma con i ciotoli.
reviewTextParts/Liked: La struttura era molto bella e ben curata, tanti spazi differenti, una piscina vicino al ristorante, ma molto piu bella quella al sottopiano , carine le stanze, buono vario e super abbondante il ristorante. Bellissima la vista, bella la spiaggia tsimento con un acqua spettacolare, struttura pulita. Un ringraziamento particolare ad Antonio che stava alla reception la notte. Accogliente, simpatico, amichevole, al check in siamo arrivati tardissimo causa ritardo aereo e lui ci ha dato la possibilità di cenare nonostante l'orario.
roomInfo: Double or Twin Room with Mountain View

reviewTextParts/Liked:
Emplacement exceptionnel et personnel attentionné.
Très bon séjour.
roomInfo: Family Suite

reviewTextParts/Disliked: Everything was just fine! Even if we had some questions we solved them with receptionist.
reviewTextParts/Liked: We spend 19 days in Peninsula resort hotel in May 2023. From the very beginning when we arrived to reception we experienced a positive atmostphere. We enjoyed beautiful hospitality at the dining hall with a wide variety of delicious dishes. The kitchen and dining hall was well organised although the number of guests rose suddenly up by 100 guests in one day when more and more holidaymakers arrived. The staff were always ready to keep up the good spirit and cleanliness. It was a beautiful privilege to see how even the head chef and his number two showed up in the dining room and we could express our gratitude him about food. Just before we left, main chef suprice us with an unforgettable surprise.   It was always a pleasant to return to our room after it was cleaned everyday by a warm-hearted Maria. And similarly we saw how everyone did their job with a good heart while serving us. The hotel's surroundings are peaceful and pleasant to take walks to, for example, a small nearby village. We will surely recommend others to enjoy that experience.
reviewTitle: An enjoyable holidays in Peninsula Resort & Spa, Thank you to all crew for making this happen.
roomInfo: Junior Suite with Sea View

reviewTextParts/Liked: The staff at the hotel was amazingly nice and helpful. The food was great and the location exceptional.

reviewTextParts/Liked: The hotel was huge, with nice pools, bars and direct access to a gorgeous beach. As it was away from the city, it was good and pleasant escape.

the buffet had a good size and the food was very tasty

the sea view from our room was so nice

reviewTextParts/Disliked: The entertainment was a bit hit and miss sometimes
reviewTextParts/Liked: amazing location! we upgraded to a room with a private pool and totally worth it. Staff were really friendly! Food had great choice!
roomInfo: Double or Twin Room with Sea View

reviewTextParts/Disliked: - The all-inclusive drinks were mediocre and only served at the main pool bar, which means if you're hanging out in the pools elsewhere, you'll need to walk very far to get your cocktails or beer (just one type of beer, unfortunately). Especially when you're hanging out at the Tsimento bar (the hotel's private beach bar), it's all paid cocktails.- The lunch and dinner grill only served one type of meat, mostly pork. Should have at least an option for non-pork eaters- Seafood night was on a weekday (Tuesday) when we stayed. We're not sure if it's rotated, hence only selected guests who stay long enough will get to enjoy it. Should have made it on a weekend night.- Choices were aplenty at the buffet but were not properly labelled, or not at all. Some had descriptive labels, and some had to guess what mystery meat or vegetables were offered. Dishes were inconsistently salted.- The wifi was spotty around the property and non-existent at the private beach.- Entertainment could be better, but I guess it's more catered to older folks who make up most of the guests. Enjoyed the Cretan night, though; great music.- Music ended at 11 pm sharp, probably due to the close proximity to the guest rooms at the main pool. - All-inclusive drinks end at 11 pm too.
reviewTextParts/Liked: We had an exceptional stay in the resort. Our goal was to do nothing but enjoy the sun, sea, and food and drinks.. and we got just that. - Clean rooms, exceptional housekeeping, and the views were spectacular. - We were upgraded to the room with the private pool for 2 out of the 5 nights we stayed, and we agreed to move back to the room we originally booked for due to availability. This was all detailed at check-in. It was a lovely experience nonetheless. - There was a main pool, two saltwater pools, a much smaller indoor pool in a separate building at the spa and a kid's pool with a slide. - The hotel's private beach access to the ocean is via two ladders and is unsuitable for folks who can't swim well without aid. The adjacent Mononaftis Beach is rocky but provides a gradual entrance into the sea.- Friendly staff at meal times, always quick to clear empty plates. Shoutout to Bobby, who always greeted us with a smile and hello at every meal. - Lovely public places and many beautiful spots to relax.- Airport transfer was pricey but convenient and punctual.
reviewTitle: Beautiful, sea front resort with incredible sea-view rooms.
roomInfo: Double or Twin Room with Sea View

reviewTextParts/Disliked: We stayed in room 704 which had a partial view of the sea. Sadly we could not sit on the balcony to enjoy it as there was an infestation of Ants all over the floor & crawling up the walls/chairs. It was a shame because we usually like sitting on the balcony with a drink in the evenings but didn't feel comfortable doing this.Its also a shame the drinks at Tsimento Bar aren't included in the all inclusive package, as it is quite far to the other bars (and up many steps). Also never known somewhere to charge €2 for table service on top of each drinks order
reviewTextParts/Liked: Loved the Tsimento Bar sea platform! The sea was very calm and so many fish if you like snorkelling!
roomInfo: Double or Twin Room with Mountain View

reviewTextParts/Disliked: Although food quality is fine, specifications of allergenic elements and vegetarian/vegan food lack or are wrongly indicated. The quality of the all inclusive drinks is really bad and need to be improved. Also the “signature drinks” were below average quality. Barmen need to be changed with more experienced guys. Our rooms was average and generally fine, but it did not correspond to the pictures illustrated online.
reviewTextParts/Liked: Very nice location, the food is quite good, considering the all inclusive formula. The staff is very kind and you have many services in the hotel (tennis, beach, pools, rentals, …). It is the ideal spot to chill and enjoy the sea, I’ll recommend it!
roomInfo: Double or Twin Room with Sea View

reviewTextParts/Disliked: The entertainment is unxceptional and feels amateur.... not enough seating for the stage and whilst the ents staff are nice they don't have the skills etc to create an amazing and inclusive night. Booking excursionsthr the hotel is far more than doing yourself.
reviewTextParts/Liked: The hotel felt 5 star....the food and drink was plentiful....the location magical.... the place was spotless and most staff were wonderful.
reviewTitle: Top end budget holiday. ( off peak)
roomInfo: Superior Double Room with Sea View

reviewTextParts/Liked: access to so many different thing, different pool, different cuisines and the activities
reviewTitle: amazing!! very much enjoyed ourselves we will be back.
roomInfo: Superior Double Room with Sea View

reviewTextParts/Disliked:
Wifi cover is not good.
The piano is not tuned :)
reviewTextParts/Liked: Great family room, sea view, food, private cement beach, sea water swimming pool
roomInfo: Family Suite

reviewTextParts/Disliked: The one think I saw that might need some improvement is the toaster. There were only two small toasters for at least 200 people eating. Obviously there were lines of people waiting to use them. I think an industrial toaster not a home toaster will help improve that.Parking is limitedIt took a call from me to the front desk to be able to turn the A/C on.I believe is a great idea that the a/c doesn't work unless all the doors and windows are closed. But informing the guests about it will save a lot of frustration. Maybe a sign on the room letting people know ?
reviewTextParts/Liked: Breakfast was good, with a variety of options to choose from and at least from the building I was staying was not too far away. The staff was truly nice and polite. The room was clean and serviced everyday The view from our room was very nice
reviewTitle: Very pleasant. I wish I could've stay longer. I will definitely would stay there again

reviewTextParts/Disliked: If you are challenged physically then the stairs to the beach platform/beach and pools could be tricky. They do have lifts though.
reviewTextParts/Liked:
From check in and check out the staff at the Peninsula we’re accommodating, polite and welcoming. We had a late check out they ensured we could keep our room to shower etc.
They made you feel that ‘nothing was a problem’
Peninsula is a large hotel and you felt like you could have various experiences around each different place/pool/beach each day.
We enjoyed the facilities around the main pool (close to snack bar/lunch etc) the Tsimento beach platform- beautiful to dive into the water and snorkel (great cocktail and very aesthetically pleasing) and the fresh water pool with lots of space to swim in and lots of sun beds.
You can rent a boat from the beach platform also. This was super easy and cheap!
We visited the small beach with a lovely family run Taverna (copious amounts of Raki and cake provided and was so fun!)
Food within the restaurant was good. Good selection and something for everyone. We went out for dinner and lunch at times to ensure we wasn’t bored.
The property is super clean and friendly. It is a nice mix of child friendly but with a mix of couples and adults.
We didn’t stay for entertainment, so cannot comment.
Agia Pelagia village is a 15 minute hilly walk but ‘doable’ we even walked back from dinner a few times.
roomInfo: Superior Double Room with Sea View

reviewTextParts/Liked: Потрясающий отель для семейного и не только отдыха. Персонал - само очарование, встречают, как дома. Отличная территория для вечерних прогулок и посиделок у моря. Свой пляж со всем необходимым. Еда и напитки по системе все включено - вкусные и разнообразные. Раз в неделю вечер морепродуктов и еще один раз - критской кухни. reviewTextParts/Disliked: Hotelanlage:- Kaum Sportangebote (z.B. Fitnessraum)- "Gaming-Room" war ein dunkles Loch mit 2 Billard-Tischen und einem Mini-Flipper- Zu wenige Sonnenschirme- Keine Bar beim SalzwasserpoolZimmer:- Nebengebäude, daher schlechtes WLAN- Billige Plastikstühle auf der Terrasse- Zimmersafe nur gegen Zusatzgebühr- Duschwasser war entweder lauwarm oder heiß (bei 32° wäre eine kalte Dusche manchmal toll gewesen)Essen:- Abgesehen von den "Live-Cooking"-Stationen, haben einige Angebote am Buffet eher an Kantinenessen erinnert- (All-Inclusive) Getränke waren entweder verwässert, viel zu süß oder generell ungenießbar- Sehr geringe Auswahl an All-Inclusive "Cocktails", die mit billigem Alkohol und noch billigeren Mischgetränken zubereitet wurden und keine "Cocktails" waren, sondern Longdrinks- All-Inclusive Weiß-&Rotwein waren ungenießbar, Bier & Rosé waren trinkbar (Nach Tag 2 haben wir entweder für gute Cocktails gezahlt, am Kiosk etwas gekauft oder mit Eistee gemischt, denn der war so süß, dass er den schlechten Alkohol ausreichend überdeckt hat)- Außer Themenabend kaum griechische/lokale Gerichte- Obstauswahl bestand nur aus Wasser-&Honigmelone- Á la Carte Restaurant war weder die Zeit, noch das Geld wert (fairerweise: Bei uns war überbucht, wir haben trotz Reservierung 3h gewartet und Essen war höchstens akzeptabel)- Geringe Anzahl an Plätzen mit Meerblick (stark umkämpft)Lage:- Sontiges:- Animations- bzw. Abendprogramm war ein Witz (u.a. alles auf Französisch)- Nach schlechtem Abendprogramm, ab 23 Uhr, ging nichts mehr (weder Musik, noch All-Inclusive Getränke oder irgendetwas)- All-Inclusive wäre nicht nötig gewesen
reviewTextParts/Liked:
- Pärchen, Mitte 20, All-Inclusive, 1 Woche Ende Juli, Feriensaison -
Hotelanlage:
+ Schöne, terrassenartige, grün-angelegte, große Hotelanlage mit 2 Pools und direktem Zugang zu 2 Stränden
+ Bilderbuch Ausblick auf's Meer von vielen Stellen aus (u.a. Restaurants)
+ 2 Pools, "oben" Süßwasserpool, "unten" Salzwasserpool. Beide mit Meerblick, ausreichend Liegen
+ Überdachte Zone beim Salzwasserpool für ausreichend Schattenplätze
+ Poolanlagen nicht überlaufen, selbst in Feriensaison
Zimmer:
+ Super schönes, helles, sauberes Zimmer
+ Sehr bequemes Bett
+ Geräumige, frisch riechende Schränke
+ Individuell einstellbare Klimatisierung
+ Schöne, große Terrasse
+ Sehr gründlicher und schneller Zimmerservice, allgemein sehr sauber
+ Jeden Tag 2 Flaschen Wasser gratis auf's Zimmer
+ Strandhandtücher gratis verfügbar (All-Inclusive, sonst 10€ Kaution)
Essen:
+ Große Buffetauswahl mit je frisch zubereiteten Gerichten (z.B. Pancakes,Pizza uvm)
+ Wechselnde Themenabende mit leckeren Specials
+ Gute Auswahl an frischen Salatzutaten
+ Frisch gepresster O-Saft zum Frühstück
+ Sehr gute NON-All-Inclusive Cocktails (8-12€)
Lage:
+ 2 Strände
+ Private Beach: Betonierte Fläche; hoteleigen; kostenlose Liegen; eigene Bar (aber keine Cocktails dort!); ruhig in einer Bucht gelegen; schnell erreichbar
+ Public Beach: Feiner Kiesstrand; öffentlich; Liegen (7€/Tag für 2 Liegen); schnell erreichbar; schön gelegen in Bucht; flaches, klares Wasser; Life Guard; preiswerte Kiosks für Snacks/Getränke/Souvenirs; Restaurants direkt am Strand, die auch gute Cocktails direkt an die Liege bringen (5-10€)
+ Dörfchen in der Nähe (15min zu Fuß, Supermarkt und Restaurants); Heraklion ca.
reviewTitle: Tolles Hotel - Wunderschöne, ruhige Lage - Traumhafte Auszeit am Meer - Aber kleine Mankos
roomInfo: Double or Twin Room with Mountain View

reviewTextParts/Liked: abbiamo soggiornato una settimana in questo albergo e siamo stati veramente soddisfatti! La vista, la stanza spaziosa, la quiete, gli ambienti all'aperto e soprattutto la qualità del cibo. Ogni giorno proposte diverse, abbondanza di verdure freschissime, angolo vegano e cene a tema con prodotti locali.
roomInfo: Junior Suite with Sea View

reviewTextParts/Disliked: Le restaurant était trop bruyant et non climatisé. Les plats n’était pas qualitatif (sauf les pizzas, mais difficile de se nourrir que de pizzas pendant les vacances 😅) et présence de viande dans la plus part des plats, ainsi que des boissons trop sucrés et pas fraîche. Le ménage des chambres était tardif (16h-17h) mais de bonne qualité. Les animations le soir sont à revoir , trop bruyante et inintéressante. La plage ne contenait pas de sable, ce qui est très désagréable mais parfait pour la plongée. Beaucoup de marche, certes très présente dans ces milieux montagneux, mais certaines étaient cassés et donc dangereuse. Les portes des chambres n’étaient pas assez isolante et les rangements dans la chambre pas assez présent. Hôtel très isolé, obligé de prendre un taxi pour trouver un magasin. La fin de la restauration du soir était trop tôt (21h30) , assez handicapant pendant les vacance. Le personnel du restaurant n’était pas assez nombreux donc débordée (les clients allaient même jusqu’à débarrasser leurs propres assiettes, ce qui est incroyable quand on paye 5000€ pour une semaine), les tables n’étaient jamais propres quand on s’installait et les couvert jamais posé sur la table. Les plages avoisinantes ainsi que celle de l’hôtel et l’es piscine de ce dernier ne possédaient pas assez de transats. Bref, organisation et accueil à revoir !!!!
reviewTextParts/Liked: La vue et le cadre sont les principaux atouts de cet hôtel. Un petit déjeuner est présent pour les personnes qui se réveillent tardivement. Il y a beaucoup de poissons à la plage de l’hôtel
roomInfo: Two-Bedroom Bungalow with Sea View

propertyResponse: Thank you for taking the time to provide us with your feedback. We are pleased to hear that at least you enjoyed our decor and pool facilities but are very alarmed by your rating. We deeply regret to learn about the challenges you encountered. For others reading this review, indeed there is an animation program and disco until 23:00. The atmosphere at the Pool Bar is quite busy during August as there are many teens and children staying at the hotel - the setting is very different during all other months. Many guests seem to enjoy this vibrant atmosphere and we have received very positive feedback about the animation team this season. We understand however, that others with younger children may prefer a calmer setting. We will try and find a solution that can cater to both. Regarding the restaurant information, we are eager to hear more so that we can address the issue. In any case, sincere apologies for the inconveniences.
reviewTextParts/Disliked:
très bruyant jusqu'à 23 h. musique extérieure.
tres mal insonorisé
portes qui claquent
petit parking d accès difficile. rempli de quads. une fois bloqué par une voiture qui nous empêchait de sortir.
mauvaise info a la réception pour restaurant annexe...
reviewTextParts/Liked:
decor
piscines
roomInfo: Superior Double Room with Sea View

propertyResponse: Thank you for taking the time to share your valuable feedback. We are truly sorry to learn that your recent stay did not meet your expectations. We deeply regret any dissatisfaction caused, particularly regarding the state of our public bathrooms. Rest assured, we are addressing this issue promptly to ensure a clean and well-maintained environment for all our guests. Regarding the beaches, we do believe that the direct access provided from our platform adds a unique dimension to our location but also understand that it is not to everyone’s liking. We take your comments about the all-inclusive drinks seriously and are implementing necessary measures to enhance the quality of our beverage offerings. Your feedback is instrumental in guiding us towards improvement. Once again, we apologise for any inconveniences you experienced during your stay.
reviewTextParts/Disliked:
- toilettes et douches “publique” dans l’hotel extrêmement sale
- la formule “all inclusive” absolument pas rentable, les cocktail gratuit sont imbuvables, et les sodas et bières sont coupés avec de l’eau. L’annonce indique 3 plages cependant 2 des 3 plages sont payantes et non comprises dans le all-inclusive (bains de soleil 5 eur)
- animation pas exceptionnel
- le manque de sourire du personnel
reviewTextParts/Liked:
La vue
La chambre
Les repas du petit déjeuné et du diner.
reviewTitle: Bien pour une semaine , mais pas plus long. Et vraiment deçu du “all inclusive”.
roomInfo: Double or Twin Room with Mountain View

reviewTextParts/Disliked:
Bar o punti per acqua e bibite troppo lontani dal
Mare.
Area serale povera e poche sedie.
Animazione troppo francese.
In una stanza non ristrutturata il bagno era davvero orribile e la doccia era rotta.
Shuttle bus è un autobus di linea che parte vicino all’aeroporto!!! Non è un servizio dell hotel!
reviewTextParts/Liked:
Struttura bella ma molto semplice e non ha molto della Grecia. Alcune stanze sono ristrutturate e sono molto belle con un bel panorama davanti. Infatti il Peninsula è proprio sopra una bellissima baia!
Cucina e snack bar accettabile è molto ricca.. qualità media. Personale molto gentile!!
Accesso al mare scomodo con i passeggini.. ma mare è bellissimo!
Campi da tennis sono piacevole distrazione.
Nemo - cocktail bar fuori dal
Villaggio fa drink molto buoni!!
reviewTitle: Piacevole soggiorno. Ok per chi vuole questo tipo di vacanza senza troppo lusso.
roomInfo: Family Suite

reviewTextParts/Disliked: Zu wenig Plätze am Strand, Strand außerdem nur eine Betonplatte, Pools schon am Morgen mit Handtüchern belegt, zu wenig Plätze insgesamt.
reviewTextParts/Liked: Saubere Zimmer, schöne Lage mit Blick übers Meer, Anlage sehr weitläufig
reviewTitle: Insgesamt eine schöne Anlage, jedoch für reinen Badeurlaub weniger geeignet, außer man geht schon früh morgens ans Meer
roomInfo: Double or Twin Room with Mountain View

reviewTextParts/Disliked: La chambre
reviewTextParts/Liked: Le site et la gentillesse du personnel

reviewTextParts/Disliked: Tony i receptionen var fantastisk, resten af personalet lignede nogle der ikke havde lyst til at være der. "Underholdnings" holdet fra helvede gjorde det heller ikke bedre. De havde en kæmpe fest selv, men virkede underligt fejlplaceret på et familie hotel, havde passet bedre ind på Ibiza
reviewTextParts/Liked: Placeringen er virkelig vidunderlig
roomInfo: Family Suite

reviewTextParts/Disliked:
Nous ne savions pas que l’hôtel proposait des formules club (tour operator)
Nous n’y serions certainement pas allés
reviewTextParts/Liked: La chambre vue sur mer, propre, moderne avec une magnifique vue, l accès à la mer , la vue panoramique  du bar au niveau de la réception

reviewTextParts/Disliked: Manque d activité ( quasi nul )Mauvaise odeur dans la chambre bien de l évacuation sanitaire demande intervention des personnels rien à changé
reviewTextParts/Liked: L emplacement Tous le monde parle en français
reviewTitle: Agréable sans plus mais je n irai plus au même endroit
roomInfo: Two-Bedroom Family Room with Sea View

reviewTextParts/Disliked: Das Mobilar ist we teilweise schon kaputt. So war ein Sideboard deutlich gebrochen, sehr wackelig das ganz, sodass man da nichts abstellen wollte. War eben irgendwie zusammengeflickt worden. Es gab einen Kühlschrank im Zimmer. Der war irgendwie im Kleiderschrank untergebracht. Ob das so klug ist, bei der Wärme, die so ein Kühlschrank produziert, halte ich für fraglich.  Essen war 3/5, man musste eben die Meute satt bekommen. Was uns wahnsinnig gestört hat: Getränke aus Pappbechern! Nachhaltig sieht zum einen anders aus und zum andern ist das eher so ein „Kaffee- an der-Tankstelle-Feeling“. Zum Essen dann teilweise so kleine Holzlöffel. Ja-immerhin aus Holz, aber eben auch nur im Einmal-Gebrauch. Die ganze Animation und das Abendprogramm war durchgängig nur auf Französisch… nun, das Hotel wird wohl von nem französischen Cluburlaub-Anbieter angeboten… das erklärt das Ganze zwar, allerdings hätte man sowas auch gerne irgendwie in die Hotelbeschreibung aufnehmen können. Es wird außerdem damit geworben, dass es einen Flughafen-Shuttle gibt. Das ist schlicht und ergreifend falsch. Gibt es nicht. Man sollte sich also ein Taxi für den Weg zum Flughafen organisieren. Und, Achtung: AI ist dort nicht direkt alles AI, wird einem nur nicht erzählt. Beispielsweise die Tsimento-Bar unten an der Badestelle beim Bootsverleih ist nicht inbegriffen. Das muss man wissen, denn zurück zur inkludierten Bar ist es schon etwas weiter mit vielen Treppen. Ist schon irgendwie Abzocke, denn bei den dort herrschenden Temperaturen muss man ja trinken… die Pools schließen außerdem um 18 Uhr. Relativ unschön, wenn man sich abends noch etwas abkühlen möchte.
reviewTextParts/Liked: Die Lage war wunderschön. Unser Zimmer hatte den tollen Meerblick, wo dann auch der Sonnenaufgang zu sehe war. Zimmer waren soweit sauber, Bett sehr bequem. Personal weitestgehend sehr freundlich. Beim Essen wurde täglich variiert. Gut auch, dass nicht bis spät in die Nacht hinein die Musik aufgedreht wird. So wird allen Bedürfnissen Rechnung getragen.
reviewTitle: Alles in allem war das ein schöner Urlaub. Für 3 Tage absolut okay, für länger wer das für uns nichts.
roomInfo: Double or Twin Room with Sea View

reviewTextParts/Disliked: The hotel was changing my towels and bed linen every day. I appreciate they want to keep us happy, but they definitely need to put in place some environmentally friendly options (many hotels do nowadays!), like if towels are hanging, no need to change every day.That is an awful amount of water for all the guests, plus transport,  etc.
reviewTextParts/Liked: A great stay, all in all everything was nice. Service was good and prompt, food was tasty, even the coffee was fine. For people who enjoy swimming, the sea is just amazing, the water is fabulous.
reviewTitle: Overall super nice place to be, great views and sea
roomInfo: Superior Double Room with Sea View

reviewTextParts/Disliked:
ROOM:
Negatives:
- no hair conditioner, which you need after being in the salt water pool or sea
- smallest bottles of shower gel (huge waste of plastic) which wasn't very good quality and scentless. I would recommended bringing your own toiletries.
- The bedding is a sheet and very thin blanket, we had to ask for multiple blankets as the room was freezing at night (without air con), I ended up sleeping under 2x blankets and 2x dressing gowns as I was so cold and there were no duvets. Even with 2x pillows from home, it wasn't very comfortable.
- The corridors are loud in the night when people arrive/leave or come back from a late night. There doesn't seem to be any courtesy by other guests as they stumble in past 11pm.
DRINKS/FOOD:
- The all inclusive cocktails were disgusting - no effort went into them and they were served in basic glasses. Clearly trying to get you to pay for them.
- There seemed to be NO monitoring of all inclusive guests/other boards, anyone could walk in to any meal and pick up food or order at a bar.. we felt a bit like we may have overpaid as everyone seemed to have the same benefits as us?
ATMOSPHERE/ENTERNTAINMENT:
The animation team is French, so all entertainment is in French. Which we didn't mind as an English couple because it wasn't as cringe! But it is very loud and shouty, so you can hear it from your room until it ends at 11pm.
A lot of guests smoked cigarettes, there was no confined area to do this so most evenings ended with my clothes stinking of other peoples cigarettes and smoke blown over you.
We opted to go out for drinks in the evening as it was more relaxing.
SPA:
The spa pool was covered (indoor) and empty, it was also right next to a children's pool with slides, so I can't image it would be very relaxing.
QUAD BIKE SAFARI (from hotel):
they get you off the quads 4-5 times, which is really annoying as we would rather be riding them than standing around in abandoned villages.
reviewTextParts/Liked: ROOM: Sea View Double - An unobstructed view of the sea, 5ft bed, shower room. The bedroom and bathroom were cleaned everyday.ATMOSPHERE:The hotel has mainly French guests. We went during September, so there weren't many children either, mainly babies if any.SWIMMING POOLS:Main pool - by the main restaurant, ​the animation team were around playing music, zumba, aqua-aerobics, games etc. The main pool is INCREDIBLY deep, at 5ft 3 I couldn't touch the floor at any part of the pool which meant I could take part in aqua-aerobics as I was just fighting to stay afloat the entire time!Salt Water Pool - this is great, less busy as there isn't a bar on this level. Again it is VERY deep, but has a little plunge pool by it.SEA ACCESS:Best feature. Concrete was was brilliant (no sand!), stair access to the sea.Tsimento Bar has really friendly staff and plays better music than main pool. Umbrellas and sun loungers provided free, able to sunbathe all day until sunsets.FOOD:We were impressed, especially for the price, large variety at each meal, rarely repeated meals. Always traditional greek food on offer, seafood night and the other themed nights were good fun too.DRINKS:the paid for cocktails (c. 10€) were really good, all inclusive wine and beer were ok.Local bar - Yamas on the walk to Agia Pelagia was great, brilliant views and well priced cocktails (a lot better than hotels free/paid for drinks)SPA:Massages were great, Maria and the other masseuse gave a good service.EXCURSIONS:Jennifer the customer liaison officer was brilliant, she is fluent in 4 languages! (English, French, German and Greek) She organised us a full day boat trip to Dia Island and also recommended a few places to visit as we rented a car; Chania, Knossos Palace. There is also a quad bike safari that leaves from the hotel and goes into the mountains.
reviewTitle: Good value for money, especially if you do own thing and stay away from the main crowd
roomInfo: Double or Twin Room with Sea View

reviewTextParts/Disliked: The french "beauf" music was not necessary
reviewTextParts/Liked: Perfecly located, sea & pool, food is good menu changes daily this is a very good point
reviewTitle: Lovely place to stay for a few nights
roomInfo: Double or Twin Room with Sea View

reviewTextParts/Disliked: Some facilities could be renewed
reviewTextParts/Liked: Amazing location, nice staff and good food
reviewTitle: Nice place in amazing location with everything you need to just relax and enjoy the sea
roomInfo: Superior Double Room with Sea View

reviewTextParts/Disliked:
Could use one more lift to get you all the way down to the hotel’s beach.
The animation team seemed to be mostly French speaking? 🤔😆
reviewTextParts/Liked: Very kind staff, great rooms, amazing views..
roomInfo: Double or Twin Room with Sea View

reviewTextParts/Disliked: Nothing!
reviewTextParts/Liked: I can’t fault anything at all! Food was delicious, entertainment was great and the views are INSANE. Rooms were clean and had everything. The hotel staff are so attentive and will help you with anything. Pablo, Yiannis and Klaudi on the bars were so helpful and they went above and beyond! We have already booked to return next year!
roomInfo: Double or Twin Room with Mountain View

reviewTextParts/Liked: Surprisingly delicious Cretan food, helpful staff and good value for money. I really liked our room's view of the neighboring hills, it was especially nice around sunset. The overall location of the hotel was ideal. Clean surrounding sea, gardens and was also near other wavier beaches - great for water sports - a big plus for me. A new favorite stop on our annual Cretan road trip.
roomInfo: Double or Twin Room with Mountain View

reviewTextParts/Liked: I had the best bachelorette party ever! We got an upgrade to a room with a private pool and had a blast! Great atmosphere, cocktails, food and of course staff! Thank you!!
roomInfo: Double or Twin Room with Mountain View

reviewTextParts/Liked: First of all would like to say that we had fantastic time. The staff were extremely polite and helpful. The hotel has stunning sea views and is also surrounded by several beaches. All inclusive drinks such as cocktail were disappointing. If you want a delicious cocktail you have to pay. But the all inclusive food was very tasty. The variety of foods were wide. The room were clean and spacious.
roomInfo: Two-Bedroom Family Room with Sea View

reviewTextParts/Disliked:
We didn’t like the fact that staff didn’t delivered shampoo and shower gel when cleaning the rooms, there were a 2 gels and 2 shampoos only at check-in. Also, for 7 days of rest, 2 small packs of orange juice were delivered only 3 times out of 7. Not sure why don’t we got the juice other times.
There is not enough mosquito netting on the balcony, a lot of insects fly into the room at night if you like to sleep with opened balcony.
All swimming pools close at 18:00, it is very early for a beach holiday, we would like them to be closed at least at 20:00.
Check-in at 15:00 is very late, taking into account that at 11:00 check-out from the room.
Nobody changes beach towels, if you want to change them you need to pay 2 euros apiece.
The barbecue chef does not grill kebabs enough, often raw meat (pork!), which is very dangerous, We would like the chef to be more attentive.
The soup is the same every day.
reviewTextParts/Liked:
I and my wife rested in this hotel for a week. Long story short: clean rooms, a lot of food, good drinks, there are 3 pools (one of them is with sea water), a very big and wonderful view on all the hotel territory, mountains and clean sea.
We took the simplest room with a garden view. Our plane arrived at 3 am and at 4 am we were already at the hotel. We booked a transfer from the hotel in advance. We were greeted with a sign, very quickly and comfortably delivered to the hotel, a one-way transfer costs 40 euros (for a maximum of 4 people). Check-in is only at 15:00, it is very late. We were lucky because the hotel management had the opportunity to check in for free at 4 am instead of 3 pm. Also as I understand we were upgraded for free to the sea view apartments. Thank you very much for this to the managers and receptionist, we are very grateful. The room was clean, staff did cleaning every day, changed bed linen and towels in the room, brought 2 bottles of water. Additional slippers are provided, which were even changed after 5 days, bathrobes, beach towels also. In the dining room, you need to wear a mask, handle your hands and wear disposable gloves. The food was varied, as for all inclusive in Europe, but not always tasty, this is for everyone to his own taste. Pizzaiolo makes the most delicious pizza we've ever tasted in our life. (P.s. thank you very much a man who did this wonderful pizza). We liked the Delicious fresh juices for breakfast.  Once a week, there was a seafood dinner. Also couple of times we had Greek traditional dished on a dinner.  There is an entertainment program every evening: karaoke, comedy shows, etc. Hotel had an own souvenir shop on the territory, but there are also other souvenir shops within walking distance (on one of the beaches).
roomInfo: Double or Twin Room with Mountain View

reviewTextParts/Disliked: nothing to dislike really, sometimes we could hear the music from the entertainment area in our room but it seems it finishes before 11pm so not a big deal
reviewTextParts/Liked: beautifully located, spacious room, lovely view from the balcony, nice breakfast, access to the sea, nice pool area, we are not fans of all inclusive holidays but we enjoyed our stay and can imagine all inclusive lovers will be over the moon, we had no problem to find a space to park the car (early June)
roomInfo: Double or Twin Room with Sea View

reviewTextParts/Disliked: There were two very rude bar men at the main pool hotel.
reviewTextParts/Liked: I think the hotel was perfect.
roomInfo: Double or Twin Room with Sea View

reviewTextParts/Disliked: Picking at straws here…but the wifi was a little bit temperamental and cut in and out when up by the pool area and snack & pool bars but no issues in the rooms. The pool area became quite busy at times due to being close to the all inclusive bars, but it was easy to escape the main pool area like we did and chill elsewhere.
reviewTextParts/Liked: Beautiful location, friendly staff and buffet food options were fantastic! Jennifer, the customer relations officer was lovely and helped us book in for our Quad bike safari (definitely a must do). It was a lovely first impression to be welcomed personally to the resort by Jennifer on our first evening. The Tsimento beach bar was our favourite place to chill right next to the crystal clear waters. The sun beds at this bar were included in the all inclusive booking but the drinks at this bar weren’t (all inclusive bars were close to the main pool) - however we didn’t mind as the cocktails from the bar were delicious (particularly the Athenian Spritz). The whole resort was spotless and it was lovely to come back to our room in the afternoon all clean with fresh water and orange juice in the mini fridge and clean beach towels. We originally booked the standard room with sea view, however were pleasantly surprised to open the door to our room and find it to be one of the junior suites with a picture postcard view! Recommend hiring a boat for a couple hours and exploring the secluded beaches and caves…Perfect location for an engagement :)
reviewTitle: Loved our stay at this beautiful resort! Perfect location for an engagement :)
roomInfo: Double or Twin Room with Sea View

reviewTextParts/Disliked: The variety of food prevailed over the quality. Even though fitness, some spa facilities, and activities were mentioned in the description, all the spa was for extra charge, no gym, and animation was weird. Nothing for young people. Only one of two beaches provided sun loungers and umbrellas for free. Outdated design of the rooms and the whole hotel doesn’t seem 4 stars
reviewTextParts/Liked: Impressive nature where the resort is located. Big variety of dishes for every meal including the Greek cuisine. Good work of the staff. Perfect cleaning every day. Great live music concerts in the beautiful lounge zone.
reviewTitle: Good resort in the picturesque location
roomInfo: Superior Sea View Room with Private Pool

reviewTextParts/Liked: It was an extraordinary stay for me and my wife. The service was perfect. Staff was very helpful and nice. The occasion was my wife's birthday so the birthday experience inside the room was perfect and she liked it. The view was spectacular and the food was very delicious. Highly recommended.
roomInfo: Superior Double Room with Sea View

reviewTextParts/Disliked:
the buffet food …(  to be honest it was the first time we tried an all inclusive rate and ate buffet food )
we tried to eat at the restaurant but was fully booked ..
reviewTextParts/Liked:
The staff were extremely nice … our room
was Amazing ! private pool , stunning view !
exceptional ! Good massage and the “floating breakfast “ ! is a must while staying in a room with private pool
roomInfo: Superior Double Room with Sea View

reviewTextParts/Disliked: .They really need to expand their music selections. While most of the entertainment was in French, there was a lot in English.
reviewTextParts/Liked: The location was amazing. 3 beaches and a village within walking distance. Food and drinks were good.
roomInfo: Double or Twin Room with Mountain View

reviewTextParts/Disliked: Food was cold
reviewTextParts/Liked: beaches views
roomInfo: Double or Twin Room with Sea View

reviewTextParts/Disliked:
The food was good - but there could have been more options for vegans. There were no dessert options for vegans or protein options and this was disappointing. It would have been easy to have a vegan cake, vegan sorbet and some veggie sausages or veggie nuggets etc. that was a bit disappointing as I had previously heard the food was very good.
It was also difficult to find out what was in the food as there often weren’t any labels.
reviewTextParts/Liked: The view is sensational and the access to a variety of beaches, pools, bars and relaxation areas is wonderful. The style of the hotel is very classic, crisp and clean. It was so clean! I couldn’t fault it and the staff were very helpful, especially the bar staff and the waiting staff. We loved the beauty of the whole place, not just the views. We will definitely come back :)
reviewTitle: Pristine - perfect views we will never forget!
roomInfo: Double or Twin Room with Mountain View

reviewTextParts/Liked: very respectful and friendly staff
roomInfo: Junior Suite with Sea View

reviewTextParts/Disliked:
The things we were not enjoying was the selection on the “cocktails” and the wine in the all inclusive deal. The wine was so bad and the cocktails were definitely not cocktails, but just a spirit and soda or juice. We were quite disappointed that we couldn’t even get a gin & tonic - even though this is actually also just a spirit and soda. The cocktails we could pay for however was excellent.
For the entertainment (the heliades) it was a shame that all of it was in French and the few things said in English was not understandable - this could be a lot better. For example the quiz. Every question was written in French, but it wouldn’t be difficult just to add the question in English on the screen as well.
reviewTextParts/Liked:
We stayed for 10 days and loved it. We got the room with mountain side, but had view to both the mountains and ocean, so we were very happy with and it was close to both the pool and restaurant.
It is a beautiful resort and the food was good. Outside of the buffet, there’s a pasta making station, as well as a pizza station, so one can always get a good “just made” pasta dish or pizza. There’s also a grill station which changes every day for both lunch and dinner, so we were always exited to see what they were serving.
roomInfo: Double or Twin Room with Mountain View

reviewTextParts/Disliked: Absolutely nothing! All was great!!
reviewTextParts/Liked: My husband and I travelled with pur 2years old. At arrival they upgraded us from a Junior suit to a family room! Fantastic location, fantastic facilities! The sea water pool is wonderfully located and the private beach ao beautiful! Furthermore, we enjoyed the kids pool with the slides very much! The staff was very nice and helpful! We stayed for 11 night and the buffet was offering a lot of options, also for the little one. Great vacation!
roomInfo: Junior Suite with Sea View

reviewTextParts/Disliked: Very French-centered activities.In the sea water pool, people "reserve" their chairs by putting towels in it since early morning and return two hours later. Sometimes you arrive at the pool at 10am and there are very scarce occupied sits, no one in the pool but basically no available sits for you. I'd suggest reinforcing some sort of check to avoid this situation. I have seen a fight between people because of that (a couple reserved a seat, another couple arrived and removed their stuff because they were not there, and when the first couple arrived there was a huge discussion).A very small point, it was possible to order Ouzo from the tsimento beach bar last year, and this year it was no longer possible, only on the snack bar. Bring back ouzo! :)Sometimes food was too salty.
reviewTextParts/Liked: Always a pleasure to return to this hotel. It was our second time in it.Very friendly staff.Good food with a lot of variety.Two big pools and the possibility to dive in the sea.Easy access to nearby beaches for water activities. Many car rental agencies nearby.Our room was well equipped, with a big TV, a small fridge, two bathrooms, three beds and space to put all our clothes. We also had beach towels offered.The room had sea view and a big balcony.
roomInfo: Double or Twin Room with Sea View

reviewTextParts/Disliked: Not included fresh juices, good coffee and good drinks (even local)
reviewTextParts/Liked: Sea
roomInfo: Double or Twin Room with Mountain View

reviewTextParts/Disliked: The rooms are very simple, breakfast and dinner are basic, the reception girls are not polite enough. But overall experience was great because of the extraordinary location.
reviewTextParts/Liked: The hotel is situated in a very beautiful bay of Agia Pelagia. Sea is very clean. The hotel is close to Heraklion. SPA is very good.
reviewTitle: 4 stars hotel in a very beautiful place
roomInfo: Superior Double Room with Sea View

reviewTextParts/Liked: Fantastic location and amenities with friendly staff.
roomInfo: Double or Twin Room with Mountain View

reviewTextParts/Liked: Great hotel to relax right on the seafront - amazing spot for swimming in clear waters. The room was very modern and spacious. I also loved the lunch and dinner at the all inclusive restaurant - great variety and flavours. I would have liked to stay longer to get a chance to play more tennis.
roomInfo: Double or Twin Room with Mountain View

reviewTextParts/Disliked: Smelly mop to wipe the room floor
reviewTextParts/Liked: Free room upgrade, food, sea, everyday cleaning service, and their hospitality
roomInfo: Superior Double Room with Sea View

reviewTextParts/Disliked: Silly things let it down at times. Such as the poor man trying to make everyone freshly squeezed orange juice for a line of people each morning with one orange squeezer was ridiculous. I felt the bar at the bottom should have been able to offer me the same drinks they they were selling to paying guests and be available on my all inclusive package. I shouldn’t have to go all the way back up the top for a rum and coke. Also snacks should have been available to guests at same said bar as part of the all inclusive package, such as sandwiches, bbq etc. No bar at salt water pool, again quite a walk to get a drink etc.  In the main restaurant only some of the food had labels on so you had no clue what some of it was.
reviewTextParts/Liked: Like most people say the food is really good. Very well presented and a good variety. The resort itself is much bigger than I thought it would be and the views around the resort were stunning. As a family with a six year old and two teenagers there was lots to do. The sea at the bottom had a new trendy sitting area and bar and it was great to  be able to jump into the Cristal clear water. Will go back again!
reviewTitle: A great place to stay and get away from it all. Fabulous food and beautiful views.
roomInfo: Double or Twin Room with Sea View

reviewTextParts/Disliked:
Management of the hotel has a lot of room for improvement, feels 3 star rather than 4 star. For example:
1) they didn’t book us a taxi transfer from port on arrival despite we communicated and requested this with them via bookings; when we called from port they did arrange one to pick us up then but communication wasn’t excellent. No apologies whatsoever.
2) the hotel gets the bulk of its guests from non English speaking EU countries but not from the Uk so a lot of staff don’t speak good English. This includes one of the two reception ladies unfortunately (who was also not very courteous/friendly for a receptionist at an entertainment place) A lot of junior staff around - cleaning rooms and restaurants etc - who are all nice, but you rarely see any managers onsite who knows the stuff when you needed to ask questions slightly out of ordinary.
Hotel is on a cliff, there are two beaches nearby but we hadn’t realized it until we arrived that the beaches are tiny and pebbly, they aren’t hotels private beaches and the hotel doesn’t operate on the beaches at all (ie no hotel beds or bar etc). This was disappointing.
The hotel has two main swimming pools plus a small toddler pool with a couple of slides and a small indoor swimming pool by the spa. One of the main swimming pool is salt water pool - don’t really see the point of this as if I want to swim in salt water I’d go to the sea. Pool can be a refreshing change from the sea as it’s not salt water!  So this leaves one main pool for most guests. the pool’s shallow end is still too deep at prob 1.5m and goes deeper rapidly so most adults can only stand in a very small part of the pool. Also loud music all day by the pool. After a couple of days we went to the small toddler pool (we have no toddlers) instead when no one is there. One of the slide of the toddler pool doesn’t work but no one came to fix it over the entire 8 days we were there. We didn’t need to use it so ok.
reviewTextParts/Liked: Food was not bad for a buffet. Dinner menus are changed daily and sometimes they put up a theme night. We are family of four stayed in a two bedrooms room. Rooms seemed newly refurbished and are clean. Beds are comfortable. Hotel is located on a cliff so have lovely sea views everywhere.  Staff are all friendly.
roomInfo: Two-Bedroom Family Room with Sea View

reviewTextParts/Disliked: Pas d’ambiance, buffet souvent la même chose, pas d’activités prévues quotidiennement
reviewTextParts/Liked: La propreté
roomInfo: Two-Bedroom Family Room with Sea View

reviewTextParts/Disliked:
Ein paar Infos vorweg:
Diese Bewertung bezieht sich auf die exakte Buchung, die wir vollzogen haben (Zimmer, All-Inclusive...). Würde ich nur die Hotelanlage an sich bewerten, würde sie besser ausfallen.
Wir sind ein Studenten-Paar, haben beide vor kurzer Zeit unsere Abschlussarbeit eingereicht und zufällig fällt unser Jahrestag in den gleichen Zeitraum. Wir haben uns hier also mal richtig was gegönnt, was eigentlich gar nicht so unbedingt in unserem Budget liegt. Durch diesen Punkt muss ich einige Aspekte sehr kritisch hinterfragen...
Die Buchung wie wir sie durchgeführt haben, ist leider ein Witz. - "All-Inclusive" bedeutet in diesem Hotel Zugang zu einer Snackbar zu haben, die nur bis 17:00 Uhr besetzt ist (in diesem Zeitraum fanden bereits 2 Mahlzeiten am Tag statt) und liebloses Fingerfood wie Hotdogs oder schlecht zubereitete Cocktails anbietet (die Cocktails sind entweder viel zu stark oder viel zu sehr mit Wasser verdünnt. Man kriegt das Gefühl, schlechte Longdrinks zu konsumieren. Mit Cocktails hat das wenig zu tun). Die Anlage verfügt über 2 weitere Bars, die nicht vom All-Inclusive Angebot abgedeckt sind (?). Im Speisesaal interessiert sich niemand dafür, ob du eine Halbpension gebucht hast oder Geld für All-Inclusive ausgegeben hast; nicht falsch verstehen - ich habe mich für die Leute sehr gefreut, trotzdem ist das ein Punkt an dem wir hätten Geld sparen können - und dieser Aspekt wird sich weiter durch diese Bewertung ziehen.
Da wir uns richtig was gönnen wollten, haben wir uns für das Zimmer mit Privatpool entschieden...Als wir in dieses Zimmer reingekommen sind, konnten wir unser Glück zunächst kaum glauben. Das Zimmer und insbesondere der Balkon mit dem großen Pool und dessen Aussicht aufs Meer ist unbeschreiblich schön.
- Leider wird das Wasser im Pool nicht aufgewärmt, sodass das Wasser eiskalt ist und es für mich unmöglich gemacht hat, den Pool zu verwenden.
reviewTextParts/Liked:
Einige positive Aspekte:
- Das Essen ist ein Traum. Es gibt jeden(!) Tag neue Gerichte, eine gigantische Auswahl von hausgemachten "Fast-Food-Gerichten" á la Pommdöner bis hin zur Meeresplatte aus der Haute Cuisine. Die Getränkeauswahl ist ausreichend, wenn auch nicht überwältigend. Der Nachtisch ist ebenfalls sehr ansprechend, abwechslungsreich und lecker.
- Die Hotelanlage und insbesondere dessen Lage an sich ist traumhaft. Wer beim Buchen einige Euro mehr in die Hand nimmt und sich für ein Zimmer mit Meerblick entscheidet wird definitiv nicht enttäuscht werden; die Hotelanlage ist nahezu direkt am Meer gelegen (siehe Bilder des Resorts hier auf booking.com) - man hört je nach Wellengang das Meer bis ins Zimmer. Die Anlage ist sehr sauber und gepflegt. Das Personal (insbesondere Rezeption) ist hilfsbereit, freundlich und zuvorkommend. Ich kann hier kein schlechtes Wort verlieren.
- Das Abendprogramm ist abwechslungsreich, wenn auch nicht optimal (siehe oben) gestaltet. - Die Kids-Disko sowie generell der Umgang mit Familien und Kindern, ausgehend vom Personal, ist mir persönlich - auch wenn es uns nicht betroffen hat - sehr positiv in Erinnerung geblieben.
Zusammenfassend steckt sicherlich auch einiges an Enttäuschung und Frustration in dieser Bewertung. Interessierten möchte ich nicht grundsätzlich von einer Buchung abraten, allerdings von einer Buchung des All-Inclusive Angebots, denn dieses ist vollkommen unnütz, sowie für genaue Überlegungen bezüglich des Zimmers anregen - der Privatpool wirkt verlockend, ist allerdings kaum entspannt nutzbar.
roomInfo: Superior Sea View Room with Private Pool

reviewTextParts/Disliked: teilweise laute Musik im Bereich des Pools, unterschiedliche Beschallung von zwei Quellen - sehr verstörend,Animationsprogramm aus unserer Sicht nicht notwendig, Animationspersonal jedoch in Ordnung - nicht aufdringlich!kein Mehrzugang unterhalb des Meerwasserpool vorhanden!!!links der kleine Strand (hunderte Liegestühle, so dich wie nirgendwo) auch nicht ansprechend

reviewTextParts/Disliked: Later op de dag en in de avond was er steeds een ontspanningsprogramma, karaoke ed  waarbij de muziek erg hard stond en de commentator eveneens. Dat vonden wij  hinderlijk bv ook de keer dat we a la carte zaten te eten ,  je zou dan een ander type muziek , meer op de achtergrond verwachten. Overigens is het een beetje omslachtig het resort met de auto te bereiken. Wij bezochten het resort eind april , het weer was goed, maar helaas waren de meeste  restaurantjes aan de stranden, dus buiten resort nog niet open.
reviewTextParts/Liked: De ligging is prachtig aan een mooie baai. De kamer goed en schoon, inclusief strandbadlakens. Prima wifi. Fijn zout water zwembad. Het eten was afwisselend en goed, voor ieder wat wils. Mooi terras.

reviewTextParts/Disliked:
nur ein Pool offen hatte, dort wurde man von zwei Seiten mit Musik zugedröhnt. Kinderdisco war einmal, was für unsere Tochter mehr als traurig war. als wir nachfragten erhielten wir eher eine patzige Antwort.
Negativ war für uns auch alles auf Französisch, wenn es mal ein Programm gab. (eher blieb es abends ruhig). Die Gäste waren auf sich gestellt.
Essen war oft kalt, alles gegrillte war schwarz u schmeckte einfach nur verbrannt. Störend war für uns auch die Hygiene! Es wurde alles mit einen Lappen abgewischt. Gläser bzw. Tassen waren verschmutzt u wenn sie alle waren, wurde selten nachgefüllt. Man trank sein Kaffee dann früh aus Pappbecher. Inclusivgetränke  konnte man teilweise nicht trinken,
Man fühlte sich leider nicht als Gast willkommen.
Negativ fanden wir auch den Strand. Hier wurde tolle Liegen, ein Bar angepriesen. Liegen waren leider so wenig, dass man sich teilweise auf die Steine setzen musste. Bar war geschlossen, der untere Pool war komplett zu / warum, hat uns keiner mitgeteilt! Einen Tag vor unser Abreise, sind wir zur Rezeption um alles zu bezahlen. Wir teilten der Dame mit, dass wir
früh 4.30 Uhr abreisen. Es wurde weder nachgefragt, ob wir etwas zu essen mitnehmen möchten, noch wie es uns gefallen hat. Leider fühlte man sich "null" willkommen. Das ganze Hotel ist sehr Französisch ausgerichtet, man sollte sich dies bewusst sein, wenn man die Unterkunft bucht. Ganz furchtbar fanden wir die Animation bzw. die Personen, die es ausführten. Kinder sind hier eher nicht willkommen, so unser Eindruck. Schade. wir können gar nicht verstehen, dass dies als fabelhaft angepriesen wird.
reviewTextParts/Liked: Der mega Ausblick, tolle Bucht, mit einen schönen Blick wenn die Sonne aufgeht. Zimmer war sehr geräumig. Jeden Tag saubergemacht u die Handtücher gewechselt. Tennisplätze standen kostenlos zur Verfügung.
reviewTitle: Leider sind wir von einem 4 Sterne Sparhotel mega enttäuscht!!! wir lieben Griechenland aber dieses Hotel empfehlen wir
roomInfo: Double or Twin Room with Sea View

propertyResponse:
Dear Floor, 
Thank you so much for taking the time to share your rating and valuable feedback. We would just like to share with you that the hotel does have solar panels, they are located on the terrace of the main building. The food waste from the main restaurant is collected and given to the pigs of Fodele village. Our kitchen staff has also been trained extensively in cooking with as minimal waste as possible. We are also in the process of introducing a one card policy per room but decided to exempt family rooms. All the flyers and collateral you mention are currently being updated - everything will be in place next season! On the info guide / map provided upon arrival, we also state that towels are not changed daily and that if guests want to change their towels, they should leave them in the sink or floor. If they were changed daily, it was most probably a misguided attempt by the housekeeping staff to provide better service. We will discuss and explain that this is not correct. We are generally aiming to improve our environmental policy. Hopefully, you will see an improvement next time you visit!
Warmest regards, 
The Peninsula Team
reviewTextParts/Disliked: ontzettend aardige mensen, maar vanuit het milieu en het doel om minder energie te gaan verbruiken is er geen enkele poging om duurzaam te zijn, geen zonnepanelen, geen waterbesparende flyers of kranen, niks tegen voedselverspilling, kaart kun je overdag in de houder plaatsen waardoor je alle elektriciteit overdag aan kunt houden. Niet eens een kaartje waarin men vraagt of je de kamer wel of niet wil laten schoonmaken en handdoeken hoeven niet iedere dag nieuw. Doe dit allemaal en het hotel verdient meer en de gast heeft een betere beleving!
reviewTextParts/Liked: Het aardige personeel bij de receptie en het restaurant, het uitzicht en de bedden.
